intro: Mussaenda cordifolia, commonly known as the heart-shaped Mussaenda, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, yellowish-white bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. The botanical features of Mussaenda cordifolia make it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
